thread.title: Lindy Ruff on quick rematch with Penguins; Patrick Eaves could be back soon, says Jim Nill
thread.title_full: Lindy Ruff on quick rematch with Penguins; Patrick Eaves could be back soon, says Jim Nill | Dallas Morning News

author: Mike Heika
title: Lindy Ruff on quick rematch with Penguins; Patrick Eaves could be back soon, says Jim Nill
text:
PITTSBURGH -- The Stars beat Pittsburgh 3-0 in Dallas Oct. 8 and then had what seemed to be a rare rematch against an Eastern Conference team just two weeks later.
"For me, it creates a little bit more compete," Ruff said. "When you're playing a team that's fresh in your memory, maybe there's some hits or plays in that game that will affect how the (next) game is played."
Dallas also will meet Florida Saturday after playing the Panthers last Saturday. And the Stars will have seven days between games against Toronto Nov.2 on the road and Nov. 10 at home.
Briefly
-- Stars defensemen Jamie Oleksiak and Patrik Nemeth were healthy scratches for the seventh consecutive game. Ruff said Jordie Benn and Jyrki Jokipakka continue to succeed on the third pair, so they get to stay in.
"There's that competition to stay in, and I think our defensive core for the most part has played very well," Ruff said.
-- Stars wingers Patrick Eaves (lower body), Curtis McKenzie (lower body) and Travis Moen (upper body) continue to sit out. Eaves could be ready sometime next week, according to Stars GM Jim Nill. McKenzie could be ready in two to three weeks.
